Node.definition: = songs in which action humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= action by which humans speak to other humans about certain matters with appreciation
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= state in which an event is of an extraordinary nature
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= process by which an event is being performed with intensity and power
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others
= action by which humans refer to a particular object when speaking
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
literally: remembrance; hence: = action by which memories of certain divine activities are celebrated in word or song
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly
= state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: long of nostrils, long of breath; hence: = pertaining to not being given to anger
literally: long of nostrils; hence: = ability to restrain oneself from expressing one's displeasure; ≈ regarded as wisdom
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved

= someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which an event is of an extraordinary nature
= action by which humans refer to a particular object when speaking
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which an event is of an extraordinary nature
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from falling or collapsing by taking hold of them
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to return to an upright position; ≈ associated with freedom and honor

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans look forward with confidence for something to happen
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
literally: to open (one's) hand; hence: = state in which humans or deities are willing to give

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to stretch out (one's) hands (to someone); hence: = action by which humans give generously to someone else

Node.gloss: to give (one's) fill > to make contented

Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= an adverb that specifies unending time
